intro: Senecio itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Brazil. It is a perennial herb with a compact, cushion-like growth form, adapted to high-altitude environments. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, branched inflorescences, typical of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a serrated margin, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Senecio itatiaiae is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
